intro: Axinaea reginae, commonly known as the royal axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptic, with a glossy surface. Axinaea reginae is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
